text: Persona 3 and 4 reportedly clock in over 100 hours each. I couldn't stand them because of the repetition...
author: jb1980ist

text: Really? Took me 70 to beat the main campaign, and only after did I start on side quests. Plugged in well over 100 hours by the time I was done. DQVII would almost undeniably be #1 on such a list. I'd really like to know if any game is longer.
author: Arc13

text: This is one of the BEST RPG's that I've ever had the pleasure of playing. Like SupraDarky said, some of those stories were SOOOOO well written and they definetly pull at the heart strings big time. To date, this game holds the record for taking the most amount of hours for me to finish it. I believe I finished at 137 hours! This game is amazing! If you've never played it, buckle in for a long and awesome adventure!
author: DAWells1983

text: I beat Xenoblade in 83 hours but at least 20 of those were taken up by the sidequests. In contrast, I can't see DQVII being beaten any earlier than 80 hours. It's hard to remember if I did any side stuff but I don't recall any.

author: SupraDarky

text: I completed this game last month (took me 105 hours to max/do everything) and I loved it. I kept pushing the game away because it was intimidating to start playing such a notoriously huge RPG. It's now my third favorite in the series after 5 and 3. It's basically a series of substories and some of them were super well written and memorable, even emotional. Unfortunately, there's some padding that lengthens the game by about 20-30 hours since you basically have to revisit each town/dungeon twice.
author: SupraDarky
